trans-unit.source: The final optional step of this tutorial is to check in the SQL Database associated with the mobile service an review the stored data.
trans-unit.target: The final optional step of this tutorial is to check in the SQL Database associated with the mobile service an review the stored data.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the Windows Store app. Your query will be similar to the following query but use your database name instead of todolist.
trans-unit.target: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the Windows Store app. Your query will be similar to the following query but use your database name instead of todolist.

trans-unit.source: Note that the table includes Id, _createdAt, _updatedAt, and __version columns.
trans-unit.target: Note that the table includes Id, _createdAt, _updatedAt, and __version columns.

trans-unit.source: These columns support offline data sync and are implemented in the <linkText>EntityData</linkText><title></title> base class.
trans-unit.target: These columns support offline data sync and are implemented in the <linkText>EntityData</linkText><title></title> base class.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with offline data sync].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with offline data sync].
